qas.question: What is identified as determining how a person views him or herself to a significant degree?
What are racial, religious, ethnic, and occupational aspects aspects of?
Identity refers to the capacity for self-reflection and awareness in what scientific study?
What type of identity is less important in psychology?
What what does not dictate to a significant degree how one views oneself?
What other aspects of identity are more important than gender?
What refers to capacity for self reflection and awareness of others?

context: <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Gender identity<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> forms an important part of identity in psychology, as it dictates to a significant degree how one views oneself both as a person and in relation to other people, ideas and nature. Other aspects of <a1_0>identity<a1_0/>, such as <b5_0>racial, religious, ethnic, occupational<b5_0/>… etc. may also be more or less significant – or significant in some situations but not in others (Weinreich & Saunderson 2003 pp26–34). In <a2_0>cognitive psychology<a2_0/>, the term "<b6_0>identity<b6_0/>" refers to the capacity for self-reflection and the awareness of self.(Leary & Tangney 2003, p. 3)
